source.name: Asset Tokenization: Security and Trust Aspects
source.instructions: Which of the following statements accurately describe the security and trust aspects of asset tokenization? Select all that apply.

answers.answer: Blockchain's decentralized nature enhances the security of tokenized assets
Asset tokenization provides an immutable record of ownership
Tokenized assets are immune to all forms of cyber attacks
Blockchain technology allows for easy verification of ownership claims
Asset tokenization eliminates the need for third-party verification in all transactions

source.guidance: This question assesses understanding of the security and trust features in asset tokenization. The correct options highlight key aspects: enhanced security through decentralization, immutable ownership records, and easy verification of ownership claims. The incorrect options address common misconceptions: while tokenization enhances security, it doesn't make assets immune to all cyber attacks, and it doesn't completely eliminate the need for third-party verification in all cases. This question encourages critical thinking about the security benefits and limitations of tokenized assets.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT evaluate the security and trust features of asset tokenization
